Body: Baker made 43 cakes and 114 pastries. If he sold 154 pastries and 78 cakes
Question: How many more pastries than cakes did baker sell?

Body: Haley has 20 marbles. In her class 2 boys love to play marbles. If she distributes her marbles equally
Question: How many will each of the boys receive?

Body: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. They have 4 sets of tables and each set has 3 chairs. If a total of 14 people will attend the party
Question: How many more chairs will they have to buy?

Body: Last week Fred had 19 dollars and Jason had 16 dollars. They washed cars over the weekend and now Fred has 40 dollars and Jason has 69 dollars.
Question: How much money did Fred earn over the weekend?

Body: Paco had 25 cookies. He ate 5 of them. Then he bought 3 more cookies
Question: How many more cookies did he eat than those he bought?

Body: Rachel has 4 apple trees. She picked 7 apples from each of her trees. Now the trees have a total 29 apples still on them.
Question: How many apples did Rachel pick in all?

Body: Jake has 8 fewer peaches and 10 more apples than Steven. Steven has 11 apples and 18 peaches.
Question: How many more peaches than apples does Steven have?

Body: A grocery store had a total of 30 bottles of which 28 were bottles of regular soda and the rest were bottles of diet soda.
Question: How many bottles of diet soda did they have?

Body: The Ferris wheel in paradise park has 2 small seats and 23 large seats. Each small seat can hold 14 people and large seat can hold 54 people.
Question: How many people can ride the Ferris wheel on small seats?

Body: Debby bought 360 soda bottles and 162 water bottles when they were on sale. If she drank 122 water bottles and 9 soda bottles a day
Question: How many days would the soda bottles last?
